captions.text: So, last week Simon wowed you with his amazing Draw My Life drawing skills,
skillz with a z, but as for today, hi, I'm Martina
and this is Draw My Life.

I came into this world in a very dramatic 
 fashion. (Drama queen! I was a bald baby!)
My mom almost gave birth to me in our car.

My dad, in an attempt to get to the hospital 
 on time, had to drive the wrong way
on a one way street because the May 1st, (What am I gonna do?!)
May-Day parade was blocking the fastest route. (Son of a b*tch parade!)
Well, some police officers stopped him,

but once they realized what was up,  (Holy 
 shit! Let's go!!!) (Dad) (Yay a parade!) (Ahhhhhh!)
I got a full police escort, baby,
through the parade and to the hospital. (Police escort, kind of...)
Aw yeah, to ruining a parade.
My mom made it to the hospital, and I was quickly born.
My sister, who is almost six years older than me,
was SUPER DUPER excited to have a baby sister, (Awesome!) (A baby sistar!!)

(Terrible bowl haircut.) so, I didn't experience a lot 
 of those door slamming, screaming, girly fights

(Called all her friends!) (6 years?) that a 
 lot of sisters talk about growing up.

Nope. My sister was a very fun, older sister who 
 would dress me up like a doll, (Bad makeup)
(Mom's dress) and create like treasure hunts for me,

and even create haunted houses for me and my neighbor Miki 
 to play in! (My sister, Nicole, Miki, Martina) (Haunted!!!)

As I got older, she introduced me to some 
 awesome music, (long hair, always ponytail plus headband)
and we shared all of our clothing.

Well... I started to get too big for her clothing, 
 but she could still take mine. (CD, tape, Closet)
And still does. (Nicole is size 0-1, me 8-10)

I'm super lucky to have such an awesome, big sister that 
 was never ashamed to have her little sister hanging around.
(Love you, banana, best big sister!) Go apple, go orange, go BANANA!
So, speaking of my friend Miki, (Japanese, Canadian, Scottish)

(Chinese, Jamaican, David, Christine) Miki and her family moved from Japan to our 
 little street, (Miki, Miho, Nicole, Martina) when I was really little.

(No kids yet!!!) We had a neighborhood of awesome 
 people, and we all hung out together.

Miki and I grew up playing together, and without my 
 realizing it, (Play dough, swimming, hide and seek)
she introduced me to Japanese, Korean culture. (Walked to school together...)

Her mom would always make us these amazing little rice 
 balls with some magical seasoning that tasted awesome

(Cute aprons!) and for every birthday, I'd beg 
 Miki's mom to make them for me.

Now that I think about it, it's probably the equivalent of making 
 a peanut butter and jelly sandwich and being amazed by it.

(Wow!!! What the f*ck is this?) But hey, this 
 is a new culture to me, okay? (Bread!)
Everything about Miki's home seemed magical.
The tiny rabbit doll house filled with little human objects, (Me)

the blue and pink haired twin angel toys, (Little Twin Stars Kiki and Lala) 
 the long legged cartoon with big, round, puffy, yellow balls on her head,

reading comic books backwards: it all just blew my 
 mind. (Sorry Sailor Moon! Forgive me!!!) (Magic stuff)
Every summer Miki would come back from Japan (So sad) (Bye!)
and bring me something, and soon I got to know these characters better.

I fell in love with Sailor Moon, but my other friends at 
 school didn't know what I was talking about. (Magic stuff)

Soon, Sailor Moon the cartoon came to Canada 
 on YTV, and I couldn't believe it.
I watched every episode and every rerun.
I even bought the soundtrack. (Sailor Moon CD)

I was freaking devasted to find out that they weren't going 
 to air the rest of the episodes. (Lip balm)
I became a kind of Sailor Moon fanatic,
using the internet to find anything I could about the series,
and I soon discovered that there were entire comic books about her, (Manga)
but they were only in Japanese,
and the drawings were so much more beautiful than the TV show.

I started to collect Sailor Moon stuff from 
 all over tiny Japanese shops around Toronto,
and outside of Toronto. (Kimchi...jig...gay???) (Huh?)
(Onigiri) But, from there I discovered more comics

(Kimchi verses sushi verses sashimi) and more food and this whole 
 other world existing outside of North American culture.

(verses Pho verses dimsum) I tried to meet other people 
 who were also interested in Japanese and Korean things,
(Yummy!) but... I really couldn't find anyone besides Miki. (Is that seaweed? No way!)
And Miki would tell me all these stories about Japan (It's really good!)
(Idiot!!) and karoke culture, and those rice balls that I loved,
and how they are avaliable at any corner store for cheap. (Japan)
(Facebook) I just kept my hobby to myself.
(Kpop group) I had to surf the internet looking for friends,

but there weren't any forums. No tumblr, no facebook, 
 nada. (Sailor Moon love, Dr. Who, Harry Potter)
Oh, I did have one friend named Tuxedo Mask, on mIRC,
who lived in South Carolina. Anyone else remember that?
Before Twitter, MSM Messenger, before ICQ, there was mIRC.

Ok, sorry, I need to stop, and shake my 
 ol' cane at you. (Back in my day...)

The whole point of this long ramble was that there really wasn't anyone to 
 talk to. (EYK.com) (Boys over Flowers) (Me too!) (I love it!) (Paradise!!!)
But, since we started Eat Your Kimchi,

I feel like the nasties are the group of friends 
 I didn't have (My people!) (Big Bang? U-Kiss?)
when I was growing up. (SNSD? T-ara? Infinite?)

(Manwha? Manga? Rice balls?) Now I found a whole, new group 
 of friends from all over the world, (Visual Kei, Gackt)
who like K-dramas and J-dramas and who understand my Sailor Moon references, (Nasties)
and listen to Kpop and read manga and manwha

and dress up like Sailor Moon for Halloween in 
 high school. (Not weird anymore!! Or am I?...)
No? Maybe that last one was just me. (Ya!) (No?)
So, besides my fascination with Japanese culture,
I did have lots of friends growing up.
I was actually a big, ole tomboy,
and I loved playing sports.
Because of that, I had lots of boy friends,
but not like boyfriends, just like friends as boys.

I wasn't really in the "female" category, (Boy 
 not girl) according to my male friends,
(No drink buying...ever..) with the baggy t-shirts and baggy jean shorts.
Thanks, guys.
But, I had lots of friends due to my joking nature.
I really haven't changed that much since grade one.
To add to my already overwhelming sex appeal,

in grade six, we were all tested for "musical talent" 
 to see who could join music class. (Music Teacher)

I was selected and was super excited to play 
 the drums, or the guitar, or the trumpet,
and I was like, oh yeah!!!

But the music teacher asked if anyone could 
 make a sacrifice for just one year
and play the baritone, not the baritone sax,
one of these: because if we didn’t have a baritone,
we wouldn’t have a low brass section, and we couldn’t join any competitions.

(Ok! 1 year, not bad) So I volunteered to 
 play what looked to me like a tuba,

well it turns out I was forever tricked and stuck with the smexy 
 baritone. (Grade 5, 6, 7, 8) Yup, once I entered high school,

the music teacher needed a low brass section... and I forever 
 played the baritone. (High school, grade 9) (Baritone, right?)
WHY ARE THERE NO TUBA PLAYERS TO SAVE ME!!??

There is nothing like playing a super sexy baritone in front of the 
 whole high school for every event and holiday. (Brap! Brap! verses)
OH MY GOD, MUSIC STUDENT,
YOU PLAY THAT FLUTE/GUITAR/DRUM/VIOLIN/PIANO/ SO WELL!  (Spit valve, oh you so nasty!)

(Oh well, might as well own it!) HEY MARTINA, 
 WAY TO SOUND LIKE A FART!
Back to sports.

By the time I was in high school, I had a nice 
 injury record. (Ye Olde Injury List, Old English here)
I dislocated my shoulder playing pick up football with my friends,

broke my arm and my wrist playing football, and dislocated my knee 
 in karate just by bending down into a low stance.

(Knee- worst pain to date.) After physiotherapy on the weekends, 
 it got better and I just kept playing sports,
continued to break bones and dislocate.

But in high school I dislocated my shoulder really really 
 badly for the second time,  (Ow!) (Mom)

so I was sent to the hospital for an MRI to check out 
 if I had some kind of long term damage. (Yay Canada!!!)

While I was I was prepping for the MRI, the nurses 
 injected my shoulder with that weird blue dye stuff,
and they were watching the overhead on tv.

My shoulder felt all weird after the needle so I popped 
 it back into place, something that I normally do, (Barf)
but the nurses looked really shocked.

I didn’t think anything of it. I had my MRI, which 
 sucks by the way, it's super dry lips (Hrm...)

and it’s really boring... but after I came out, there was 
 a doctor waiting for me. (I am a doctor.)

She told me she heard from the nurses I 
 had dislocated my shoulder on camera
in a way that wasn’t possible without ripping some things.

She said looking at my history of injuries, I had 
 a rare disorder call EDS, Ehlors Danlos Syndrom,
and I was suffering from Type III, (Type 3) also known as Hypermobility.

In a nut shell, I’m weirdly flexible, for example, my 
 elbows and knees bend back further than most people...

in a creepy kind of broken looking way, 
 which is a great topic for parties.
I always have joint pain, and all my joints dislocate very easily,

which explained why I dislocated my knee so easily 
 in karate. (Chronic joint pain. Knees, shoulders)

(Jaw, hip, and so on...)  I still feel the pain other people feel 
 when they dislocate joints, but it happens a lot easier for me.

So one day, I was sent to a joint 
 specialist after I dislocating my jaw,

and he apparently didn’t see a whole lot of EDS patients, and 
 decided to call the WHOLE office in to look at me!

Hey, let's look at the freak show pop her 
 joints out and bend her elbow all grossly.

I mean like he literally stuck his head out 
 into door and called everyone to see it.
So much for doctor patient confidentiality.

Since then I’ve gone on to dislocated my knee cap, and 
 jaw, and hips, and shoulders countless amounts of times.

I’ve had friends grab my hand and tug me 
 too hard and pull out my shoulder,

I’ve sat for too long on the airplane flight 
 home and pushed out my hip. (More time...)

I’m like a 90 year old woman but without 
 the love of prunes and oatmeal cookies...

oh wait..I actually really like those things...um...knitting? no. cats? 
 pies? tea? I like all of those too.
(Oh, my hip!!!) No recovery...
(Oh, my hip!!!) No recovery...

The most painful task of my day is definitely sleeping, which 
 probably explains why I don’t like going to bed. (Dothraki)

I have to sleep on a super soft foam topper with an extra 
 soft pillow to keep my jaw from dislocating, (Meemers on my head...)

(zzzz) (My hip!) and I still wake up with 
 dislocated joints no matter what.
(Everybody- lala!) I’m like a transformer in the morning... CHAJHSJKHCJAHC!

(Snap! Pop! COFFEE) But without the cool car transformation, 
 just the sounds. (Beep, beep!) (It's me!)

So after many more injuries my doctors recommended that I 
 quit sports and just stick to swimming.
But, not just swimming, gentle swimming. (Isn't this nice?)
Oh, man this totally sucks! (90- I'm not old!!!)
So even though I look normal on the outside, (Hi!)
well...arguably normal, I’m in pain everyday all day.
I do have quite a high pain tolerance now, but some days,

honestly guys it just really gets me down because there is really 
 nothing I can do about it. (Broken me, hm... that hurts...)
I realized a kind of untaught lesson because of all of this.
You know, people tell you not to judge a book by its cover,

often meaning that something doesn’t look great on the outside, but 
 it could be great on the inside. (Awesome book!)

But, what about someone who looks just, you know, normal on 
 the outside but is in pain on the inside?
You never really hear about that.

When you see someone with a cast or with a 
 cane you assume they must be in pain,
and maybe you'll be more understanding if they seem like they're down,

but if you see someone who looks seemingly healthy 
 on the outside sitting beside you in class,
you don’t ever assume anything is wrong with them.

Meanwhile people are dealing with emotional issues like 
 heartbreak, grief, failure, loneliness, family issues,
and various health disorders that can’t be physically seen.
I guess what I’m trying to say is, (Everyone goes through pain.)
just because someone looks normal on the outside, (But sometimes it's visible,)

(and sometimes it's internal.) doesn't mean they aren’t suffering or 
 enduring pain on the inside,

and I think everyone watching now has gone 
 through some kind of private suffering before.

So just when I thought I was injury 
 maxed out, (You can drive! Canada!)

like a cliche TV show moment, it was my very first 
 day driving alone after finally getting my driver's licence.

I was hit by a drunk driver when 
 I was stopped at a stop sign.
I saw the headlights coming, but I just didn’t register that he wouldn’t stop.
I remember it very clearly,

leaning forward to find a tape to change the 
 music, yes I said a tape. (Crash!)

Luckily, I had no airbag in the car or my 
 closeness to the steering wheel would have killed me.

I remember the seatbelt snapping really hard against my collarbone and 
 then hitting the back of my headrest really hard.

Unluckily, I was so far away from the headrest that I 
 cracked a vertebrae in my neck. I got whiplash,
but surprisingly I didn’t feel any pain.

(What??? Not funny!)  I was just really calm, 
 I kind of felt like (seriously)
oh my god, this is SO TYPICAL that this would happen to me.
My parents are going to be so upset.

I called my parents, and they were really upset 
 that I would joke about something like this,

but once I told them I wasn’t joking, they called my sister, 
 and they were at the scene in a jiffy. (I'm okay.)

(I don't feel so good.) I was totally fine for a 
 while, but then... I started to go numb
like half my body started to feel all weird and numb.

The ambulance finally came and took me to the 
 hospital, and I got a sexy neckbrace.
Ah yeahhh, so KyuHyun and sexy, free, and single... (Not sexy, free, or single.)
After all the x-rays and tests, a police officer came to interview me
and said that the driver that hit me was indeed super duper drunk,
and this was actually his second drunk driving accident.

Blah blah blah going to court, blah blah blah problems, blah 
 blah blah let's all skip that. (Insurance, broken car, nightmare)
Now I’m in physiotherapy, again,

to ensure that my neck will be be able to 
 bend in the future.  (Good!) (Spelling? Acupuncture?)

After the accident, I had crippling headaches, saw double vision, 
 I had problems focusing in school, (Painful physiotherapy) (Massage)
and I just felt all over crappy.
I was really angry that this happened to me.

I was angry I had to spend time after 
 school going to the physio clinic.

I was angry I had a permanent pinched nerve in my back which caused 
 my back and neck to be on fire. (Why me? Why? Unfair!)

I was angry I had a permanent pinched nerve in my back, which caused 
 my back and neck to be on fire. (Why me? Why? Unfair!)

(No fun! More pain. Worked hard!) I just felt really 
 angry and felt like it was so unfair.

But then one day I realized, maybe it was important for 
 me to get hit by this drunk driver.
What if I wasn’t there, would he have gone on to kill someone?
And that thought kind of just blew my mind.
Maybe, I was really the perfect candidate to stop that drunk driver.

Considering I was already in pain everyday, what’s an 
 additional neck problem? (Don't be so mad.)

(You are ALIVE) I should really just focus on being 
 happy (Focus on that, be happy) and realize
that I wasn't more seriously injured, you know?
(Happy!) (Cotton candy) I designed a tattoo for my neck,
which some of you might have seen, (Good friend!)

it's there to remind me to forget about the 
 pain, and to focus on something happier.
It’s kind of a complicated mirror image design, but it says HALCYON,

which is an old word that means to be 
 happy, carefree, calm, and peaceful. (My neck)
And in the same way, I don't let my pain,

whether from the past or present, get in the way of 
 me being happy. (Wow! Look at that pretty tree!!!)
Simon and I have a rule, of 2 good 1 bad,
which means every time you have one complaint about your day, (Blah Blah) (Bad!!!)
(Okay two good! Go!) you have to mention at least 2 good things.
(Um... Spudgy is still alive) So looking back on this video,
I brought up a lot of bad things, (My shoulder doesn't hurt!)

so I want to end this video mentioning those things that are 
 great in my life. (We got great fan mail) (Yea!)

1. My family is awesome. It’s a small family, 
 but they are so wonderful. (Dad, Mom, sis)

Living overseas reminds you of all the things you took 
 for granted when you lived close to them.
(Haha! OMG dad!)  I miss laughing with my joker dad,
talking over coffee re-fills with my mom, (2 hours)

and going on adventures with my sister.  (Nooo! 
 Panda Koala attack!) (Miss you, love you)
I never planned on getting married, (Ranch dressing)

so meeting and marrying Simon was a huge and 
 wonderful surprise in my life. (Love eye lasers!)

He is both my best friend and my husband, he makes me 
 laugh more than anyone else I have ever met,

and he is so supportive of everything i do. (I 
 WANT TO BE A UNICORN!!!... You can do it!)
I LOVE YOU MY SNUGLIEST DUCK!!! My little snuggly pom-pom. (I love you!) (More!!!)
(Record scratches) Everyone starts barfing.
[Sp] What about me, Mom?
[M] Oh yeah, I love you too, Spudgy.
[Dr.M] Don't forget about me, Mom.
[M] And... I also love you, Meemers.
The Nasties. I never thought I'd find such a like minded group of people,

but I guess it took starting a website which reached out 
 to people all over the world to find you guys.

Your emails and comments and support and fan mail has changed 
 my life in a way you probably didn’t realize.

As long as our videos keep making you guys laugh and smile, I 
 hope to keep making them for you. (Lonely to not alone)
Thanks so much for watching my long draw my life. (Happy!!! Thanks for watching!)
I hope you didn’t fall asleep. I know that Spudgy did. (Martina)

So if you haven't fallen asleep, you can check out 
 Simon's Draw My Life video (Ha! I'm so funny!)
from last week, and you can subscribe for more crazy videos,
except don't expect any more of these drawing videos
because they took FOREVER to do guys! (September 13th, 2004)
Like seriously, I popped a hip,
drawing on the floor for so long.
(In an old voice) I'm old Martina.
Thanks for watching this TL;DR of EYK!

comments.text:
Aww Martina!! I totally understand your daily pain, at 15 I was diagnosed 
with Rheumatoid Arthritis. Now at the ripe old age of 21, I am still 
struggling through everyday life feel like an elderly woman. Hooray!! I'm 
so glad I stumbled upon EatYourKimchi and I can learn all sorts of things 
about Korea! Growing up my best friend was from Korea and someday I really 
want to live in Korea and thanks to your videos I can learn more about what 
it's going to be like when I do. Plus you and Simon are adorable and I 
totally hope my husband and I will be as cute as you. Thanks for everything 
you do! 사랑해❤﻿

comments.author: Bryce Enold

comments.text:
OMG!!!  I started on oboe, but I sounded like a duck and I hated sounding 
like a duck, so I switched to euphonium (which they called a "baritone" but 
actually was an euphonium).  I played that until college...where I was a 
music major.  But I wanted to play more, so I switched to (French) horn, 
which is in EVERYTHING!  So then I sounded like an elephant.  Or Godzilla. 
 You pick.  :)  I still play horn...sometimes professionally...and I love 
it!  Also, I can relate to the chronic pain (also caused by a drunk 
driver!!!) but choosing to focus on the happy instead.  I have 
frustrations, but way more to be happy about.  Like kitties and puppies and 
music and food!!!﻿
comments.author: Sally Greenfield

comments.text:
Girl Ima just pause this video for a second... If we went to school 
together Id be ALL OVER that bass section. I play tuba haha. I was the 
entire bass section because no other tubas played out at all :IIIIIIIIIIIII﻿
comments.author: mansonfreak98

comments.text: WAS MIKI HER NAME OR HER LAST NAME? 'cause i know the miki family in JPN ﻿
comments.author: PAULA ESQUINCA

comments.text: I'm surprised how much Martina can draw creatively! Love this video.﻿
comments.author: Mae Hwa Oh

comments.text:
I dislocated my knee cap, it really hurt. It put itself back in, in the 
same moment and it shocked all the muscles into not working, I had to spend 
about a month working the muscle back enough to support any weight, I was 
on crutches for 2 months, and ended up having to quit dancing and 
gymnastics :'(﻿
comments.author: Mary Nichols

comments.text:
I suffer from constant body pain that isnt helped by over the counter 
medication. My doctor believes its fibromyalgia, though there is no way to 
straight up diagnose fibro, you kinda have to test for all other things it 
COULD be and rule them out. I really appreciated what you were saying about 
judging a book by its cover, how sometimes someone appears completely 
normal but you just don't know what they are going through 'behind the 
scenes' if you will. Hearing how upbeat you can be in the face of your 
chronic condition really made me think about myself and how I should just 
get on with my life, what will be will be. At least I am actually able to 
do most things other people can, right?﻿
comments.author: TheRealShunneth

comments.text:
Thank you Martina! :) I do smile listening and watching your videos! :) 
Greetings from México :) 
 Aaaaahuaa!! ﻿
comments.author: Ker dur

comments.text: (Barfing for a long time):(﻿
comments.author: Jesus Camarillo

comments.text:
OMG, you played the baritone!!! so nice to see am not the only one that 
wanted to play the trumpet or the flute, and got the baritone because the 
band need it one, but to be honest i learned to like it, and i remember 
being exited to play it :D﻿
comments.author: Gildardo Torres

comments.text:
My band director put me in the trombones! And in our super small high 
school, we had 3 trombones, so I had to sit next to the baritones, and low 
brass people are the weirdest people you will ever meet... But also some of 
the coolest.
comments.author: Bekah Burton

comments.text:
With every video I'm reminded of why EYK is so awesome. This video was

comments.text:
I feel your pains. Only like two of my friends can talk about Kpop with me.

comments.text: I'm still using mIRC lol﻿
comments.author: Flávia R.

comments.text: OMG I PLAYED BARITONE ALL THAT TIME AS WELL BRUHHHHHHHH ﻿
comments.author: TheThrifter

comments.text:
I don't have EDS but I do have Marfans so I can understand where you're 
coming from, I have lots of joint pain and my joints dislocate a lot. I saw 
this video a while back before I was diagnosed and I've been trying to find 
it again...and I found it!! It's nice to hear the stories of other people 
with connective tissue disorders!!﻿
comments.author: Mandy Schaan

comments.text:
I also have Hypermovility❗ A bit less than you Martina, but we both have 
that haha.
For example my fingers bend really far like if they were broken, it's quite 
cool sometimes. 
I'm a really big fan! Check my channel, I'm just starting 💗💗﻿
comments.author: SooYo Sung

comments.text:
I have genetic arthritis and like a million other things and 99.98% of the 
time UNLESS my arthritic knees are flaring to the point I need my cane 
and/or I have to go to my bag for my inhaler for an asthma attack or 
allergy attack that is either food related or seasonal NO ONE KNOWS!!! I 
have been like this since I was 14 but wasn't diagnosed 'til I was 17!!! 
Also, the only one everyone sees of me are my sleep issues! I have 3 sleep 
issues that cannot be controlled by meds and so I am forever falling asleep 
in public regardless of if I get a full night as my body's all as long as 
you get 6 hours I do NOT care when you're awake and you do NOT get to sleep 
anymore!!! ~senses body evil laughing!!!~ I am going to start getting vids 
up on my channel soon too once I get a new cam my old one was one of those 
trials they never mention and so all I have is an old vid of my cats!!! 
Last one before one of them was put down!!! T_T!!!

comments.text: why ytv why a anime﻿

comments.text:
Not sure if someone has mentioned this already, but airbags dont work that 
way. Unless you were shunted forward and hit someone with the front of your 
car, with sufficiently high force, a steering wheel airbag won't go off 
from just a rear impact.﻿
comments.author: disarchitected

comments.text:
+eyeluvcandii Oh right.  But Martina said, if there was an airbag, it would 
have gone off and killed her, which is not true because airbags don't work 
that way.

comments.text:
She said she didn't have an airbag. So the airbag never went off because 
there wasn't one.

comments.author: DepthofField

So what you're saying is... Sailor Moon is a gateway drug to Korean

Then I'm waaaaaaay overdue and will be plotting my exodus shortly :3﻿
comments.author: Voodoo Taylor

comments.text:
i really love EYK! Martina you are super awesome! I am so sorry you have to 
go through EDS. I don't have EDS but I have IBS. More people know about 
IBS, but there are many people that think it isn't a real thing. It's 
internal and you can look all normal on the outside. People are not very 
sympathetic about it, especially jobs. It's a major reason I have never 
traveled much. However, I can deal with the pain better with meditation and 
other things. Thank you for sharing! I can't see any reason why someone 
would vote this down - just mean people I think. Stay your awesome 
wonderful self. ﻿
comments.author: LS7

comments.text: I know you live in Canada But what city?﻿

comments.author: TheAdorablepolish

comments.text:
I can almost guarantee that you played the euphonium and not the baritone.  
They are indeed different.  If it looked like a tuba, you played the 
euphonium.  They call them baritones because it's easier to say.﻿
comments.author: Emmy W

comments.text:
Sailor Pluto costume sophomore year, oh yeah! Martina, you are not alone :D 
I also suffer from chronic muscle tension, which eventually lead to the 
lovely symptom of a constant headache (as in never-ending pressure and pain 
and the Negaverse) that would get worse with physical exertion - no hot 
sun, sports, or exercise for me! Oh, aren't our bodies fun? Stay beautiful 
inside and out <3﻿
comments.author: Novadestin

comments.text: ur amazing at drawing ﻿
comments.author: Penelope S

comments.text: I played the baritone horn too, but then I switched to tuba and trombone﻿
comments.author: kevin he

comments.text: Sounds like me o.o﻿
comments.author: RovixJumma

comments.text:
I completely agree that people may look perfect on the outside but on the 
inside they may have to go through a lot of pain. I haven't been through 
major physical pain like you but I had to go through a painful childhood, 
which can easily make me cry alone when I recall it or sometimes give me 
nightmares. I think emotional or psychological pain is just as bad as 
physical pain. ﻿
comments.author: Savennia Hanson

comments.text: That was quite inspirational.﻿
comments.author: Russell Anderson

comments.text: Leigh and Soozee should also make one of these ;3﻿
comments.author: Allan N

comments.text:
Simon and your draw my life where just such an inspiration. You both are 
really good people with positive energy coming from you in all your videos 
:) It's amazing how you're facing all hardships and live life to the 
fullest! ﻿
comments.author: DarklightAmy

comments.text:
OMG! I HAVE EDS TYPE 2! I am so glad someone I look up to is similar to me! 
I dislocate my jaw all the time by eating apples and I dislocated and tore 
all of the ligaments in my knee doing a cartwheel. Yeah, it was so 
embarrassing. But, I love you guys and you guys inspire me to do what I 
believe in! Plus, I feel your low brass pain. I play the trombone.﻿
comments.author: Jaz Harmon

comments.text:
I have EDS type 3 too! I also played Baritone in highschool as well! My 
brother's good friend was from Japan and I became great friends with her. 
She taught me Japanese and helped me go to Japan too! We have so much in 
common, I love you guys!﻿

comments.text: You guys are so cool! ﻿
